data.title: Kelly Clarkson to sign new book in Wyckoff
authors: Kara Yorio, North Jersey Media Group
data.meta_description: American Idol winner, Grammy-winning singer and mother of two, Kelly Clarkson can now add children’s book author to her lengthy resume. TELL ME MORE: “River Rose and the Magical Lullaby” tells the story of a little girl too excited about the next...
data.text:
American Idol winner, Grammy-winning singer and mother of two, Kelly Clarkson can now add children’s book author to her lengthy resume.

TELL ME MORE: “River Rose and the Magical Lullaby” tells the story of a little girl too excited about the next day’s trip to the zoo to fall asleep. Her mother sings her a lullaby that not only gets her to sleep but launches a dream of fun with animals. This is the first picture book for the 34-year-old, who burst onto the entertainment scene in 2002 in Season 1 of “American Idol.” She has gone on to win multiple Grammys and now has two children, River Rose, who is 2, and Remy, who was born in April.

Clarkson’s event is part of a “Conversations with Authors” series from Books, Bytes and Beyond bookstore in Glen Rock. The Grammy-winning singer will take part in a moderated discussion then sign the book for fans. Of course, Clarkson’s primary profession is music and the book comes with a link to download an original lullaby that Clarkson wrote and performs

DETAILS: 7 p.m. to 9:30 p.m., doors open at 6 p.m. Wednesday, Wyckoff Family YMCA, 691 Wyckoff Avenue, Wyckoff, wyckoffymca.org, 201-891-2081. Tickets are $20, which includes a book. Everyone at the event must have a ticket. Books must be purchased in advance through the Y at wyckoffymca.org, 201-891-2081. A link to purchase can also be found at booksbytesbeyond.com. They can be purchased during the day of the event. Seating is first come, first serve. Flash photography, posed pictures/selfies with Kelly and the signing of any memorabilia is not permitted.

FOR MORE INFO: booksbytesbeyond.com, kellyclarkson.com
